It's an interesting concept, however, as a privacy nerd, it leaves me unhappy.

You've mentioned that the salt could be stored or compromised, but far worse the actual OpenID used could be stored. As a privacy nerd I must assume the service is my enemy (this is why protocols like ToR and MIxmaster are set up to work even if you do not trust the nodes themselves).

I'm not sure exactly what usecase you're trying to solve. Why do you want to use your own OP at all? Why not have a string of anonymous OPs? The easiest anonymous OP implementation is one where all assertions are true (ie, anyone can "log in as" any OpenID with the OP).
